title: Mirifici Logarithmorum Canonis Descriptio
summary: Mirifici Logarithmorum Canonis Descriptio (Description of the Wonderful Canon of Logarithms, 1614) and Mirifici Logarithmorum Canonis Constructio (Construction of the Wonderful Canon of Logarithms, 1619) are two books in Latin by John Napier expounding the method of logarithms. While others had approached the idea of logarithms, notably Jost BÃ¼rgi, it was Napier who first published the concept, along with easily used precomputed tables, in his  Mirifici Logarithmorum Canonis Descriptio.[1][2][3]
